intro: Acnida tuberculata var. prostrata, commonly known as the prostrate acnida, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is a low-growing, trailing species characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant is native to southern Africa, where it typically grows in rocky or sandy soils. Its prostrate growth habit allows it to spread across the ground, forming dense mats. It is often used in landscaping for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in dry conditions.
